intro: Dortmanna engelmanniana, commonly known as Engelmann's dock, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as wetlands, stream banks, and marshes. It has alternate, palmately lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense, greenish-white inflorescences, which bloom in early to mid-summer.
